entry.title: Small fix for clearing MmapHashPrefixMap on db thread
entry.content:
I don't think it was quite safe to std::move the map_ from the main

thread, since this might invalidate iterators being used to check the

hash prefixes on the db thread. Instead, this patch waits to touch the

map until we are on the db thread. This also puts the change behind the

kMmapSafeBrowsingDatabaseAsync param so the map is always cleared on the

thread the map will be accessed on.



Bug: 1409674

Change-Id: Ifb767398f351b142ca55ddf1f2719b28e4e25b58

entry.content:
This CL adds `WelcomeTourNotificationBlocker`, which blocks all

notifications during the welcome tour.



Any notifications before or during the tour will be shown in the

with system priority will show after the tour, all others will be

permanently hidden.

entry.title: Introduce SharedDictionaryAccessChecker
entry.content:
This CL introduces SharedDictionaryAccessChecker class. This class is

used to determine whether it is allowed to use a shared dictionary.



We should not use shared dictionaries if user checked "Don't allow to

save data" for the origin. We can get the status of it by checking

CookieSettingsBase::IsFullCookieAccessAllowed() method. So

SharedDictionaryAccessChecker is using it.

(Note: This method is also used by other non-cookie features such as NEL, Service Workers.)



In succeeding CLs, this class will be extened to support notifying the

usage and the denial to the browser process.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: Add Ash support for `DownloadStatusUpdaterClient` commands.
entry.content:
This CL adds Ash support for the following

`DownloadStatusUpdaterClient` commands:



* Cancel

* Pause

* Resume

* ShowInBrowser



These commands will be invoked from Ash Chrome in response to the user

interacting with downloads rendered in ChromeOS System UI surfaces.



Follow up CLs will will add the rendered downloads to ChromeOS System UI surfaces and invoke these APIs.

entry.title: Don't restart prelaunched Lacros if deployed locally
entry.content:
When Lacros is deployed locally and tast tests are being

run with the lacros.DeployedBinary options, the state is:

- lacros_selection_ == kDeployedLocally

- user_lacros_selection_ == kRootFs



In this situation, currently locally deployed Lacros would

be prelaunched, but it would be restarted after login.

This change changes the behavior so that locally deployed

Lacros is never restarted.



BUG=None

TEST=tast run -var lacros.DeployedBinary=/usr/local/lacros-chrome

${DUT} lacros.LoginScreenLaunch.rootfs



Change-Id: If4472e7145f4d079474c6c81c8f203170b26d6bd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4651008

Reviewed-by: Hidehiko Abe

entry.title: [Red Warnings] Integrate with HaTS Service
entry.content:
Triggers the HaTS Service to launch a survey. This is the 2nd of 3 CLs.

The 3rd CL will make it possible for SSB users to see surveys and for

us to send telemetry only if the users agrees to see the survey.



TESTED=unit tests and manual testing with demo survey.



Overall design: go/crca-hats-for-red-warnings



Bug: b/278718891

Change-Id: Idd088e8c44c24d23a30ef20ce03cd37c573d7c2a

entry.title: QsRevamp: Move down popups when there's not enough space above bubble
entry.content:
When there's not enough space above the tray bubble, we want to display

the popups at the baseline in front of the bubble rather than above it.

Thus, this CL handle different situations that can change the size of

the popup collection and move it down accordingly:

- When a notification is added.

- When the popup collection's size changed (a notification updated, user

click expand a notification).



This requires us adding some new virtual functions in

MessagePopupCollection that will be customized in

AshMessagePopupCollection.

entry.title: [omnibox] Break inheritance between OmniboxPopupViewViews and *ViewWebUI
entry.content:
This CL makes OmniboxPopupViewWebUI a direct subclass of

OmniboxPopupView, breaking inheritance of OmniboxPopupViewViews. This

affords more flexibility and control while preventing potential bugs

related to the separate implementations.



Furthermore, this CL cleanly separates logical omnibox concerns from

presentation concerns. This allows simplification of omnibox classes

by keeping widget handling hidden away as an implementation detail,

and facilitates a design where the popup view can always exist even

when it isn't shown.



Bug: 1445142

entry.title: [3pp] Implement 3pp for chromium/build/fuchsia/
entry.content:
It uploads the content into the chromium/fuchsia/test-scripts cipd

package, so it can be used to share with other repos.



Unlike other implementations, `latest` returns the sha256 of the files

in the archive so that it can ignore most of the chromium changes but

focus only on the changes in the desired folder.



A TODO is to remove the irrelevant files from the cipd package, but it

is less important.



The 3pp should be automatically picked up by

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/3pp-linux-amd64-packager.



FYI: 3pp is a system to upload packages to the cipd, since manual

uploading is disallowed.

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/cipd_and_3pp.md



Change-Id: I8e61569064fd74fd17d5c6e0c7c3c06b031b7bcb

entry.title: Enable QsRevamp feature
entry.content:
Enables the QuickSettings Revamp by default (Launching M-117).



Highlights of the feature:

- Visual redesign of QuickSettings

- New sliders, Jelly style UI, Some UX changes in detailed views

- Power button is now a menu with restart/lock/power-off.

- Moving multi-signin entry point to the power menu

- Jellification of UI (fonts, colors, components)

- Moving the Notifications from above Quicksettings to a new tray

bubble



go/qs-ui

entry.title: Fix Framebuffer scaling on Android OpenXR
entry.content:
When using Shared Buffer mode OpenXR does not take into account the fact

that the page may apply a framebuffer scale to the texture that it

operates on within the page. This can result in a mismatch in sizes

on the shared buffer, which results in the framebuffer being incomplete

and operations failing (this is caught by a DCHECK in debug builds).

The error specifically notes that this is because the textures are of

different sizes.



This change renames the existing `FrameSize` variables to

`SwapchainImageSize` to better represent their usage and meaning as the

size of the textures that we have received from the OpenXR runtime. It

further adds a set of `TransferSize` variables used for keeping track of

the texture size expectations from the page, as well as a

`shared_texture_size` variable on SwapChainInfo to note the current size

of the buffer.



This change leverages these renames, as well as newly listening to the

UpdateLayerBounds message from the page, to ensure that we keep an

appropriately synced SharedBuffer size by checking the size of the

SharedBuffer before we send it to the page. This allows existing

SharedBuffers to be unmodified while potential in use and to be modified

before they are needed again, mimicking the pattern established with

XrImageTransportBase::TransferFrame.



Note that this change does not address the D3D11 side of things since

SharedBuffers are more seldomnly used there than in Android where they

are currently the only path.



There is a little bit of extra plumbing to get the SharedImageInterface

to the GraphicsBinding in the "BeginFrame" case; but this will hopefully

be resolved more cleanly after Issue 1454935 is addressed.



Finally, adds a DefaultFramebufferScale value consistent with other

Android VR runtimes, while leaving the Windows version of OpenXR

with it's current behavior of not specifying one.



Bug: 1458256

Change-Id: Ib3f88af93d46e853af79a943f5fafdeb72a5589e

entry.title: Allow LocationIconView to be hovered during page action chip animation
entry.content:
There was a bug where during the memory saver page action chip

animation (on the right side of the omnibox) if you moused over

the lock icon (LocationIconView) on the left side of the omnibox it

wouldn't show a hover indicator.



This is because the animation of the page action chip was triggering

`LocationBarView::Layout()` which was calling `SetVisible(false)` and

then `SetVisible(true)` on the LocationIconView. This had the effect

of turning off the InkDrop immediately after it is shown. The fix

is to only set the visibility of the LocationIconView once.

entry.title: DeskButton: Add custom tooltips
entry.content:
This CL allows for custom tooltips to be displayed over the desk button

when it is hovered. It does this by having the ShelfTooltipManager show

tooltips for the DeskButton and its children, and repositioning the

tooltip bubble to be centered over its anchored button. In the case that

the tooltip goes out of the bounds of the screen, we move the tooltip to

be aligned with the left or right side of the display. This CL also

adds unit tests to verify that the tooltips are positioned correctly in

all shelf alignments.

entry.title: ipcz: Eliminate Portal
entry.content:
Portal is essentially an APIObject wrapper around a Router handle. This

is wasteful since it means an extra ref count and an extra level of

indirection between caller and implementation.



This merges Portal's little functionality into Router and changes

portal API handles to opaquely reference Routers instead.



Endpoint (Portal+Router) size before: 32+184=216 bytes

Endpoint (Router) size after: 200 bytes

Currently input is a large category with a lot of overhead, computing

jank is important to not introduce extra jank, input.scrolling is the

occured.

entry.title: Avoid error when building empty Rust ASAN runtime library
entry.content:
lld-link needs `/llvmlibempty` to not produce an error when building

the empty library,



```

FAILED: local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-msvc/lib/librustc-nightly_rt.asan.lib

../../third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/lld-link /lib "/OUT:local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-msvc/lib/librustc-nightly_rt.asan.lib" /nologo /WX /ignore:4221 /llvmlibthin "@local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-msvc/lib/librustc-nightly_rt.asan.lib.rsp"

warning: no input files, not writing output file

pass /llvmlibempty to write empty .lib file,

pass /ignore:emptyoutput to suppress warning

treating warning as error due to /WX

```

entry.title: media: Remove Ctrl+S shortcut for "Save video as ..."
entry.content:
Currently the "Save video as ..." option has a short cut "Ctrl+S".

However, when pressing "Ctrl+S", it'll trigger the "Save page"

option and will not try to save the video.



For comparison, "Save image as ..." doesn't have the "Ctrl+S" option.



This was caused by https://codereview.chromium.org/825873003 landed

in 2015, when trying to fix the "Save As ..." option for plugins,

e.g. PDF viewer. For PDF the shortcut makes sense, but it reuses

IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SAVEAVAS which is also used by "Save video as",

causing the issue.



This CL fixes the issue by splitting IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SAVEAVAS

into IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SAVEAVAS and IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SAVEPLUGINAS,

so we can only add the shortcut for the latter.



Manually tested and verified that the shortcut is removed for video

but remains (and is working) for PDF.



Bug: 449029, 1457707

Test: See above

Change-Id: I73ae152035850f560495b2af72d3fc413c6dc08d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4648773

entry.content:

preview card. We should try to decouple image loading (saved in memory

to IMAX to get attribution text for the correct collection) so that the

entry.content:

If a visit's interaction state is done or its search terms match a previously done visit, then the entire cluster will be filtered from being displayed.

entry.title: Make FileMetricsProvider background tasks not block shutdown
entry.content:
To fix a shutdown hang.



Right now all background tasks are SKIP_ON_SHUTDOWN (which blocks

shutdown if the task has already started). This moves some of them

to CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN (which does not join the thread on shutdown

if it has already started). In particular, the following are now

called with CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN:

- DeleteFileWhenPossible()

- ProvideIndependentMetricsOnTaskRunner()



The following is kept as SKIP_ON_SHUTDOWN:

- CheckAndMergeMetricSourcesOnTaskRunner()



Details as to why here:

crrev.com/c/4625856/comments/e3bddb63_4609d774



Also had to change the tests a bit, since they were using

RunPendingTasks() (which is not recommended because it can result

in things that would not happen in prod). In particular, had to add

a "hook" in ScheduleSourcesCheck()/RecordSourcesChecked() which

continuously reschedules itself as long as there is still work to do,

but we want to test each individual task. See the AccessDirectory and

AccessFilteredDirectory tests.

entry.title: Add a feature flag to toggle AVIF gainmap HDR images support.
entry.content:
The flag is avif-gainmap-hdr-images. There is already a gainmap-hdr-images flag to enable gainmap rendering in general, but it's now turned on by default, so a separate flag is needed to control AVIF gainmap images.

Both flags must be turned on for AVIF gainmap image rendering to be enabled.



See also https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/how_to_add_your_feature_flag.md

Font-size-adjust returns an incorrectly serialized result when it has

the from-font value (e.g., font-size-adjust: ex-height from-font;).

FontSizeAdjust::ToString().



This change is verified with the updated unit test.

entry.title: [Part 1] Merge subprocess metrics in a background thread
entry.content:
This CL is a no-op/refactoring in preparation to move subprocess

metrics merging to the background.



This CL adds a way to determine if a request to merge child histograms

comes from a periodic log by providing an "async" parameter. However,

providers don't do anything yet with this "async" parameter.



In particular, the MetricsService fetches subprocess histograms by

calling CollectFinalMetricsForLog(), which calls

ImportProvidedHistograms() (on Chrome and WebView, not iOS and Cast),

which calls MergeHistogramDeltas() from various providers. So now,

ImportProvidedHistograms() and MergeHistogramDeltas() both take an

"async" parameter to let the providers know whether it's fine to do

the work asynchronously.

entry.content:
It would be interesting to know what effect the presence of the "Sign-in

with another device" option has for users without a passkey. The

`timeout` parameter is unused in conditional UI requests. Thus this

change enables an experiment when that is set to a magic value. It's

unclear if any sites will experiment with this but, in case they want

to, it's useful to have something ready for them.

entry.title: Propagate video visibility reset to SurfaceLayerImpl.
entry.content:
After the change introduced in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3935382

it became possible for the video submission state's visibility

to change on the main thread without SurfaceLayerImpl::WillDraw()

being aware of it on the compositor thread.



WillDraw() attempts to locally track the visibility state to avoid

unnecessary invocations of the (cross-thread) callback, but this

can lead to SurfaceLayerImpl::WillDraw thinking the

VideoFrameCompositor is set to visible when in fact it isn't,

resulting in frames not being submitted. See the associated bug

for a repro where this can occur.



This CL fixes this (potential) problem by making sure that anytime

the main thread resets the visibility for the VideoFrameCompositor,

we also plumb a reset to the active SurfaceLayerImpl in order

to reset `will_draw_` to match. This preserves WillDraw()'s ability

to limit callback invocations, but at the expense of an additional

codepath, though the latter makes the interdependence obvious.



Bug: 1434437

Change-Id: Ia7e0029eb27a208cb4b9301fd9929187181956c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4646448

entry.title: Linux sandbox: allow alarm() if using in-proc stack dumping
entry.content:
StackDumpSignalHandler() has an alarm() call (in case the default

signal handler does not crash the process, the alarm handler crashes

the process in a couple seconds). This alarm() call is a

sandbox violation and therefore crashes the process with a SIGSEGV.

Sometimes this makes tests pass and other times it makes tests fail.

Fix it by allowing alarm() in the sandbox if in-proc stack dumping

is enabled.

entry.title: pip2: Ensure the close button always works
entry.content:
This CL adds logic to manually close document picture-in-picture

windows when the close or back-to-tab button is clicked after the pip

controller has been disconnected for any reason. This prevents an issue

where the close button can become useless when an attempted navigation

disconnects the pip window, but a hung script in devtools prevents the

window from closing immediately.

entry.title: [Thumbnail Placeholder] Fix flickering globe
entry.content:
Only invalidate thumbnail if the fetcher or card size is set to null. This is a reversion to behavior prior to [1]. The new behavior

may cause intermittent flickering on Tab Groups. While this was

technically correct invalidating on every update can cause unexpected

flickering if thumbnails are slow to fetch.



In the event the thumbnail is requested and never loads, the

placeholder should still be shown as a bitmap won't be set until

a result is returned from the thumbnail fetcher. If the result is

null then we will invalidate the bitmap if it is for the most recent

request.



While on the tab switcher tabs cannot navigate so it shouldn't be possible for an outdated image to show unless mid-navigation which is

an existing behavior even prior to all these changes.



[1]

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4449751



Bug: 1457837

Change-Id: I1541d6e90b9a1b7130370b7d7c3fe64cb9180040
